body_content.explanation: to see or become conscious of something or someone:
examples: I noticed a crack in the ceiling.
Mary waved at the man but he didn't seem to notice.
He noticed (that) the woman was staring at him.
Did you notice how she did that?

body_content.explanation: to bring someone to the attention of the public, usually because of an unusual skill, etc.:
examples: She was first noticed by the critics at the age of twelve, and went on to become a world-famous violinist.

body_content.explanation: (a board, piece of paper, etc. containing) information or instructions:
examples: There was a large notice on the wall saying "No Parking".
I saw a notice in the paper announcing their marriage.

body_content.explanation: printed statements of opinion in the newspapers about plays, films, books, etc.:
examples: The musical has received wonderful notices.

body_content.explanation: information or a warning given about something that is going to happen in the future:
examples: The next time you visit, can you give me more notice?
The first responders are ready to spring into action at a moment's notice.
The building is closed until further notice (= until another official announcement is made).

body_content.explanation: the period of time that you must work after you have said that you are leaving your job, or after you have been asked to leave:
examples: Do I have to work out my notice?

body_content.explanation: to ask someone who works for you to leave their job, usually after a particular period of time:
examples: My boss gave me a month's notice.

body_content.explanation: to tell your employer or landlord that you will be leaving your job or your rented home, usually after a particular period of time:
examples: I gave my notice at work yesterday.

body_content.explanation: to tell your employer that you intend to leave your job after a particular period of time:
examples: I handed in my notice yesterday.
I put them on notice of what I expect from them.
Schools are being put on notice that if they do not show improvement, they may be shut down.
It has come to/been brought to my notice (= I have been told) that you have been late for work every day this week.
I asked him to drive more slowly, but he didn't take any notice.
